Emergency exit routes are through any available gate for this outdoor location and muster points. The facility is a non-responding facility and relies on the El Dorado Fire Department when necessary to respond to RMP chemical releases.

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:

BG Products are continually improving and implementing their PSM/RMP program and safety systems. There is a process in place for the management team to review all potential process changes, including recommendations following process hazard analysis and compliance audits.  

BG Products has completed this report to provide the public with information about our activities at this facility. We believe that, due to the many controls instituted to maintain a safe operation and our commitment to continuous improvement, an incident affecting our employees or the surrounding area is unlikely to occur.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:

The BG Products Distribution Center is not required to implement the Program Level 3 prevention program requirements under the RMP regulations because they are eligible for RMP Program Level 1. However, the BG Products is required to comply with the requirements for preventing or minimizing the consequences of catastrophic releases of flammable or explosive chemicals codified under the Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations (29 CFR 1910.119). The required elements of the PSM program relevant to general accidental release prevention are listed below:
-	Employee Participation
-	Process Safety Information
-	Process Hazard Analysis
-	Operating Procedures
-	Contractors
-	Pre-startup Safety Review
-	Mechanical Integrity
-	Hot Work Permit
-	Management of Change
-	Incident Investigation
-	Emergency Planning and Response
-	Compliance Audits
-	Trade Secrets
BG Products has a program in place to comply with these items and their specific requirements.

he five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:

The distribution center has had no accidents meeting the definition in 40 CFR 68.42 in the past five years.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

As a non-responding site, BG Products has developed a written emergency action plan (EAP) that includes activation of the local emergency notification system and calling 911 from a safe location, and directing an evacuation, including exit route assignments. All employees are trained to assist other employees in a safe and orderly evacuation. The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:

BG Products is committed to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. BG Products is considered a non-responding facility for releases of the RMP-listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan (EAP).

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:

BG Products owns and operates a warehouse located in El Dorado, Kansas. The distribution center houses various products including flammables in aerosol cans. All of the aerosol cans containing RMPregulated chemicals are stored in the warehouse flammable room in full pallet format. These aerosols contain propellants that include flammable substances that are subject to Process Safety Management (PSM) and Risk Management Program (RMP) requirements as a flammable mixture. There is no bulk (drum, tote, tank) storage or chemical processing operations at the site. The regulated chemicals at the BG Products Distribution Center consist of aerosol propellants and include the following:

  -  Butane (CAS #106-97-8), and
  -  Propane (CAS #74-98-6).

The maximum intended inventory is conservatively calculated based on every storage location full of the highest weight of the flammable product in the flammable room. The BG Products Distribution Center is eligible for the RMP Program Level 1 because the facility has not had a reportable release in the previous five years, the distance to the flammable endpoint for a worst-case release is less than the distance to any public receptor, and the facility has coordinated response efforts with the local emergency planning and response agencies.
